Issues.Title: [16.0.x] fix(core): add additional component metadata to component ID generation
Issues.Body:
This commit add `exportAs`, `inputs` and `outputs` into account when generating a component ID.

This PR is effectively a copy of https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/50336, but without `signals` field, which became available in main (would be a part of 16.1.0), but not in a patch branch.

Issues.Title: Separate signals into an independent library
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

common

### Description

Considering what signals are set out to achieve, and being very generic, it would make sense to separate them into a stand-alone library, so they are usable outside Angular, in other frameworks.

This would also let it evolve faster, with the help of a much wider community of developers.


### Proposed solution

Make signals an independent library, so it can be used elsewhere, and let people build extensions on top of them.

### Alternatives considered

RxJs is the only alternative to signals outside of Angular.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Separate signals into an independent library" (#50333)

Issues.Title: Provide InjectionToken with factory provider in a component level
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

Today, if you want to provide something with a factory provider in a component level, you have to separately create the InjectionToken and the factory function like so:

```ts
const TOKEN = new InjectionToken('my token');

...
{
  provide: TOKEN,
  useFactory: () => ... 
}
```

If you want to provide the value in root, you have a better option:

```ts
const TOKEN = new InjectionToken('my token', {
  factory: () => ...
});
```

Why is this better? 
* You have type inference for the factory value
* Your logic is encapsulated. This token knows how its value is defined and does not need to trust consumers to provide the value properly + your factory function is not exposed and cannot be used elsewhere. 
* You can instantly start using this token without needing to set up anything else / create any other kind of boilerplate code. 

Unfortunately, if you want this token to be provided in a component level, and not the root level, you can't do that. As angular's component "providers" property does not allow for InjectionTokens.

### Proposed solution

Support passing an injection token in the "providers" array of a component (and module). If this token defines its own factory - it should be used. If not - a runtime exception should be thrown. It's better if we could even type the injection token differently, so only ones that define their factory can be used. 

### Alternatives considered

Use the "FactoryProvider" syntax, which is less ideal based on what I described above. 

I'm willing to try to implement this myself, if someone with more experience with the Angular source code can point me in the right direction.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Provide InjectionToken with factory provider in a component level " (#50338)

Issues.Title: Injecting TemplateRef and directly assigning it to a #-private field doesn't work anymore
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Example directive:
```
#templateRef = this._templateRef; // undefined
#templateRef = inject(TemplateRef<unknown>); // works
templateRef = this._templateRef; // works

constructor(private readonly  _templateRef: TemplateRef<unknown>) {
  this.#templateRef = _templateRef; // works
}
```
Since the upgrade to Angular 16 `#templateRef` is now `undefined`.
If the injected TemplateRef is assigned in the constructor (or when assigning it to a non-#-private field), it works, however. Using the `inject`-function works, too.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular 16, Node 18.16, NPM
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: `fetch` only partially patched.
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

zone.js

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

While working on #50247, I believe we stumbled upon a patching issue with zone.js. 

`Zone.js` only patches the first `Promise` returned by `fetch`. The `NgZone` become stable after and doesn't wait for 2nd `Promise` (`text()` or `json()` or body which returns a `ReadableStream`). 

This is with the plugin `zone-fetch-patch` imported.  

[Stackblitz demo](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ltd9jx?)

cc @AndrewKushnir  @alan-agius4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`fetch` only partially patched. " (#50327)

Issues.Title: Not being able to use "effect()" or "takeUntilDestroyed()" inside dynamically created component
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I have searched through the issues and I wasn't able to find anything related to it. Feel free to close this issue if you think it's duplicated.

I updated my project to Angular v16 and I wanted to test a little bit the new Signals API.

I have some components that are created dynamically using the `createComponent()` API.

When I try to use `effect()` or `takeUntilDestroy()` inside these dynamically created components I get an error that I can't use them because I'm not inside an injection context.

I thought a component was a valid injection context.

What is more surprising is the fact that `toSignal()` and `inject()` do work fine inside the component but not `effect()` or `takeUntilDestroy()`. This for me is a surprise because when I look at the source code of `toSignal()` I see that it's being called `assertInInjectionContext` and it doesn't throw any error.

I have attached a codesandbox with the reproduction but I will also explain what it's happening:

- I have the `AppComponent` that has a simple button that when clicked opens a native dialog and inside it, it renders a component.

- The service for creating the component is called `DialogService` and there you can find how the component is created dynamically (feel free to correct me if the way I'm creating the component is not correct).

- Finally we have the `DialogComponent` that is the component that will be rendered inside the native dialog

- Inside the `DialogComponent` as an example I'm using `inject()`, `toSignal()`, `effect()` and `takeUntilDestroy()`

- You can comment the lines of the `effect()` and `takeUntilDestroy()` that are causing the error and leave the `effect()` and `takeUntilDestroy()` that receive as arguments the injector and the `DestroyRef` and you will see that everything now works fine.




### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

CodeSanbox:
https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/cold-sunset-csz6b2?file=%2Fsrc%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts%3A6%2C20

Github repo:
https://github.com/jordimarimon/test-injection-context-angular

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
ERROR Error: NG0203: effect() can only be used within an injection context such as a constructor, a factory function, a field initializer, or a function used with `runInInjectionContext`. Find more at https://angular.io/errors/NG0203
    at assertInInjectionContext (core.mjs:10490:15)
    at effect (core.mjs:12229:27)
    at ModalComponent.ngOnInit (modal.component.ts:48:15)
    at callHookInternal (core.mjs:3804:14)
    at callHook (core.mjs:3831:13)
    at callHooks (core.mjs:3786:17)
    at executeInitAndCheckHooks (core.mjs:3736:9)
    at refreshView (core.mjs:12417:21)
    at detectChangesInternal (core.mjs:12344:9)
    at RootViewRef.detectChanges (core.mjs:12874:9)
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 16.0.1
Node: 18.12.1
Package Manager: npm 9.5.1
OS: linux x64

Angular: 16.0.1
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1600.1
@angular-devkit/build-angular   16.0.1
@angular-devkit/core            16.0.1
@angular-devkit/schematics      16.0.1
@schematics/angular             16.0.1
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.0.4
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: Form control has incorrect value type
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

forms

### Is this a regression?

No ( not 100% sure )

### Description

Form control value is incorrectly typed when I use bindings

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-xwwgsg?file=src/index.html

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
The form input has the `number` type. You can only enter numbers. But when you click on the button, you'll notice the value is a string ( incorrect )

If you remove the binding, and explicitly set the type, the value of the form will be a number ( correct )
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

angular 15


### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: [Pagespeed] How to reduce unused JavaScript in browser.mjs, core.mjs, common.mjs?
Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request? common, core, router ### Description It seems that Google Pagespeed suggests that some Angular packages like browser.mjs, core.mjs, common.mjs, router.mjs etc contain too much unused JavaScript. For example, this is the PageSpeed Insights for Angular Documentation page. It seems to affect all Angular Apps especially on mobile https://pagespeed.web.dev/analysis/https-angular-io-docs/ebby37tj3k?form_factor=mobile ### Proposed solution Break these packages into smaller packages ### Alternatives considered Lazy loading may work for packages that aren't needed at the beginning but these packages such browser.mjs, core.mjs, router.mjs etc seem to be needed at the very beginning.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Pagespeed] How to reduce unused JavaScript in browser.mjs, core.mjs, common.mjs? " (#50315)

Issues.Title: `ng update` not resolving the correct NPM package when using `npm:<name>` syntax as version range
Issues.Body:
### Command

update

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I searched through the issues and I did found some related issues but they weren't exactly the same:

- https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/23448
- https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/10624

Feel free to close this issue if you fill like it's a duplicate of another one.

I wanted to update my angular project to the latest version and I executed the command:

```shell
ng update @angular/cli @angular/core
```

In my project I have as a development dependency `@types/web` (TypeScript DOM declaration files) because I have private libraries that use my applications and I like to make sure that all my projects use the same version of declaration files and also I like to decouple the TypeScript compiler version from the declaration files version.

The dependecy in the `package.json` looks like the following:

```
"@typescript/lib-dom": "npm:@types/web@^0.0.99"
```

You can see that the package hosted in NPM registry is `@types/web` but the name of the dependency store in `node_modules` is `@typescript/lib-dom`.  

It's this way because TypeScript will search in `/node_modules/@typescript/lib-dom` to know if the declaration files have been installed independently. If the folder is not present, it will use the declaration files that come with the TypeScript compiler (`/node_modules/typescript/lib/lib.dom.d.ts`).

When I execute the `ng update` command, I get the following error:

```shell
✔ Packages successfully installed.
Using package manager: npm
Collecting installed dependencies...
Found 16 dependencies.
Fetching dependency metadata from registry...
✖ Migration failed: 404 Not Found - GET https://registry.npmjs.org/@typescript%2flib-dom - Not found
  See ".../angular-errors.log" for further details.
```

Basically, the Angular CLI is trying to fetch `@typescript/lib-dom` but this is not the name of the package, the correct name to fetch is `@types/web`.


### Minimal Reproduction

I have created the following repository that reproduces the issue. 

You don't need to clone it, you can follow the steps explained in the `README.md`:

https://github.com/jordimarimon/angular-cli-update-issue

### Exception or Error

```text
[error] HttpErrorGeneral: 404 Not Found - GET https://registry.npmjs.org/@typescript%2flib-dom - Not found
    at /tmp/angular-cli-packages-Fv6UlW/node_modules/npm-registry-fetch/lib/check-response.js:95:15
    at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:95:5)
    at async RegistryFetcher.packument (/tmp/angular-cli-packages-Fv6UlW/node_modules/pacote/lib/registry.js:87:19)
    at async Promise.all (index 3)
    at async /tmp/angular-cli-packages-Fv6UlW/node_modules/@angular/cli/src/commands/update/schematic/index.js:671:36
    at async callRuleAsync (/tmp/angular-cli-packages-Fv6UlW/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/call.js:77:18)
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 15.2.8
Node: 18.12.1
Package Manager: npm 9.5.1
OS: linux x64

Angular: 15.2.9
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1502.8
@angular-devkit/build-angular   15.2.8
@angular-devkit/core            15.2.8
@angular-devkit/schematics      15.2.8
@angular/cli                    15.2.8
@schematics/angular             15.2.8
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      4.9.5
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

Issues.Title: Sass files not correctly compiled with new ESBuild
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler-cli

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

When Angular now compiles with the ESBuild option (using Angular 16), sass files no longer import external resources (using the `url`) correctly.
Essentially, behavior is such that if a Sass file (let's call it module A) imports another sass file (let's call it module B), and module B lives in a different directory than Module A, and Module B uses a url to point to a relative file (like a font file), when Sass compiles everything into a single Sass file, the url that's used from Module B remains the same (which is relative to the original Module B location), resulting in errors around resolving file locations (because the compiled file doesn't have the same file location as the original).
Original behavior didn't care about this, and the compiled output correctly brought linked files up and changed the url paths.
While ESBuild is called a "drop-in" replacement, this needs to be resolved.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://github.com/AStoker/esbuild-font-import

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
X [ERROR] Could not resolve "../webfonts/ShadowsIntoLight-Regular.ttf" [plugin angular-css-resource]

    src/styles.scss:6:11:
      6 │   src: url("../webfonts/ShadowsIntoLight-Regular.ttf") format("true...
        ╵            ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 16.0.1
Node: 18.15.0
Package Manager: yarn 1.22.19
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 16.0.1
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
```

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): attempt relative global script read first in esbuild builder
Issues.Body:
When using a global script (`scripts` option) with the esbuild-based browser application builder, an attempt to read the script as a relative path from the workspace root will be performed first. This avoids the need to perform a potentially expensive module resolution attempt for files that are directly available and also ensures the relative paths are given priority over any potential modules with the same name. This matches prior behavior that also preferred relative paths.

Closes #25198
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): attempt relative global script read first in esbuild builder" (#25203)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): minor sourcemap ignorelist improvements for esbuild builder
Issues.Body: This provides a minor performance benefit for the generation of the Chrome sourcemap ignorelist generation. Memory is shared were possible and string searching is reduced in certain cases.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): minor sourcemap ignorelist improvements for esbuild builder" (#25201)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): normalize Vite dev-server Windows asset paths
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based browser application builder with the Vite-based development server on Windows, source asset paths were previously not normalized prior to being included in request URLs. This could result in invalid asset request URLs due to invalid path segment separators.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): normalize Vite dev-server Windows asset paths" (#25204)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): correctly generate serviceworker hashes for binary assets
Issues.Body:
When using the esbuild-based build system with the service worker enabled, binary assets were unintentionally being hashed with the assumption of UTF-8 encoding. The assets are now hashed directly to ensure correct output hashes.

Closes #25200

Issues.Title: bug(material/chips): clicking on an editable chip focuses it and does not begin editing but pressing enter begins the editing state
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

For editable chips, clicking on the chip and pressing enter do not have the same effect. Click on the chip focuses it and doesn't have any other side effects. To begin editing the chip, the user can either press enter or double click on it. Since htis is a butotn interaciton, I would expect enter and click to perform the action of the button. Since click and enter are not consistent, that means that the editable chip doesn't conform to the ARIA button interaciton pattern.

Double click is generally not available to Screen Readers and Assistive Technology.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Navigate to "Chips with input" example on https://material.angular.io/components/chips/examples#chips-input
2. (Demo appears with favorite fruits)
3. Click on "Lemon"



### Expected Behavior

A cursor appears after "Lemon" to indicate that it is in the editing state.

This is expected because that's what pressing enter does.

### Actual Behavior

The background of "Lemon" darkens to indicated that it is focused

### Environment

- Angular:
- CDK/Material:
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):

Issues.Title: fix(material/form-field): fix duplicate announcement of form controls
Issues.Body:
Fix duplicate screen reader announcement of form controls.

Remove the aria-owns from the form label. Commit
4191b4d66e4dc79fc1dfa446caf48e5d3224d4fa added aria-owns on the label to work around issue in JAWS and NVDA. That commit is from 2017, and it appears the JAWS and NVDA issues have been fixed.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/form-field): fix duplicate announcement of form controls" (#27102)

Issues.Title: Form Field Accessor Tags for Scss and CSS
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

Prior to version 15 we are able to change the opacity on all manner of form fields, selectors, radio buttons, buttons, sliders, basically every type of component and more specifically disabled fields. 

Now, nothing I do within the main theme SCSS or the component level CSS can access the new mat-mdc-form-fields.

I think it's great that you guys are looking to come more in line with the MDC base, but please, provide in depth documentation on actually accessing the individual component classes which allow us to tailor the experience for our end users. 

Version 15 was borderline catastrophic for us, and our end users cannot handle how transparent disabled fields are.  Please provide the documentation that allows us to tweak these things again. Or give us back the old ng-deep, something, anything, that allows us to actually access the components like we used to. 

Thank you.

### Affected documentation page

https://v15.material.angular.io/components/form-field/examples
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Form Field Accessor Tags for Scss and CSS" (#27101)

Issues.Title: fix(material/paginator): add aria-hidden="true" to decorative svg's
Issues.Body:
For the mat-paginator component, add aria-hidden="true" to the decorative svg elements.

Previously, the svg elements for the chevron icons would produce an img node in the a11y tree nested under the button node for "Previous page"/"Next page". This seemed to cause issue with JAWS screenreader where screen reader navigation would have duplicate navigation (#26967).

With this change applied, the svg elements are aria-hidden and do not affect the accessibility tree. This is appripriate since the chevron icons are purely decorative.

Fix #26967
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/paginator): add aria-hidden="true" to decorative svg's" (#27083)

Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

15.1.0

### Description

In version 15.1.0, the `valueChange` event used with `matSliderThumb` would emit values continuously as the slider was being dragged. This was particularly useful for updating values in real-time during a drag operation. For instance, consider the following setup:

```html
<mat-slider>
  <input
    (dragStart)="dragSliderStartMin(index)"
    (valueChange)="minSliderValueChange($event, index)"
    matSliderStartThumb
  />
  <input
    (dragStart)="dragSliderStartMax(index)"
    (valueChange)="maxSliderValueChange($event, index)"
    matSliderEndThumb
  />
</mat-slider>
```

```ts
async dragSliderStartMin(index: number) {
  await this.loadFile(i);
}

minSliderValueChange(value: number, index: number) {
  // ...
}

// ...
```

However, in the newly released v16.0.0, this behavior appears to have changed. The `valueChange` event only emits a value when the slider dragging operation ends, as opposed to continuously during the drag.

To restore the previous behavior, one workaround I found is using `ngModel` for template-driven binding:
```html
<mat-slider>
  <input
    [(ngModel)]="sliderValue"
    (ngModelChange)="sliderValueChange($event)"
    matSliderThumb
  />
</mat-slider>
```

Alternatively, I achieved the same result by using `formControl` with reactive forms and subscribing to `valueChange`:
```html
<mat-slider>
  <input
    (dragStart)="dragSliderStartMin(index)"
    [formControl]="expectationMin($event, index)"
    matSliderStartThumb
  />
  <input
    (dragStart)="dragSliderStartMax(index)"
    [formControl]="expectationMax($event, index)"
    matSliderEndThumb
  />
</mat-slider>
```
```ts

ngOnInit() {
  this.addSubscriptions();
}

addSubscriptions() {
  this.expectationMin(this.index)
    .valueChanges.pipe(distinctUntilChanged())
    .subscribe((value) => {
      console.log('min value changed', value);
      this.minSliderValueChange(value, this.index);
    });

  // same for expectationMax and maxSliderValueChange
}
```

I wanted to bring up this change in behavior as it may impact other users who relied on the continuous value emission during slider drags in their projects. Can anyone confirm if this change was intentional or if it's a bug?

### Reproduction

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Reproduction of the issue in Angular v16.0.0

Navigate to the StackBlitz sample code for Angular v16.0.0: [Angular 16 slider with valueChanges showing value only when drag ends](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-16-material-starter-xdmmkz?file=package.json).

In this sample, notice that when you drag the slider, the value changes are only displayed when the dragging ends. This is the behavior we're discussing in this issue.

2. Comparison with the behavior in Angular v15.1.0

Now, navigate to the StackBlitz sample code for Angular v15.1.0: [Angular 15, same source code, slider with valueChanges showing value when dragging the slider](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-16-material-starter-fmmekv?file=package.json).

In this sample, when you drag the slider, the value changes are continuously displayed next to the slider as you're dragging. This is the previous behavior we're comparing to.

By observing the behavior in both versions of Angular with the same source code, you can clearly see the difference in valueChange event emissions during slider dragging.

### Expected Behavior

In Angular Material version 15.1.0, the `valueChange` event used with `matSliderThumb` was designed to emit values continuously as the slider was being dragged. This enabled real-time value updates during a drag operation. I expect to see this same behavior in Angular Material version 16.0.0.

### Actual Behavior

In Angular Material version 16.0.0, the `valueChange` event's behavior appears to have changed. Instead of emitting values continuously during the slider dragging operation, it now only emits a value when the slider drag operation ends. This change interrupts real-time value updates and only allows for updates when the user releases the slider.

### Environment

- Angular: 16.0.0
- CDK/Material: 16.0.0
- Browser(s): Version 113.0.5672.92 (Official Build) (arm64)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOs Ventura, Version 13.3.1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`valueChange` Event in v16.0.0 No Longer Emits Values Continuously During Slider Drag" (#27097)

Issues.Body: ### Is this a regression? - [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was I'm in the process of migrating to Angular v15 along with Material v15 and this is not present in v14. ### Description Seems when using a custom theme, the ripple animations don't behave correctly on any component. Issues.Title: fix(material/core): Fix MacOS Hover feature compatibility with optgroup
Issues.Body:
Corrects ARIA semantics for the mat-optgroup component. Add role="presentation" to the label and remove aria-hidden="true" from the label.

Fix compatibility issue with MAC Hover text a11y feature #27080. The label of the option group does not need to be aria-hidden, and the Mac Hover text feature seems to rely on it.

Fix #27080

Issues.Title: bug(DateAdapter): `MAT_DATE_LOCALE` injection-type doesn't support most commonly used `string`
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

_(minor bug; and casting `as string` workaround present)_

In Angular 13 ([release tag 13.0.0-next.0](https://github.com/angular/components/releases/tag/13.0.0-next.0)) date-fns support was added to the DateAdapter. 
Overall a great change, but today I encountered an issue with the `MAT_DATE_LOCALE` being type `InjectionToken<{}>` instead of the previous `InjectionToken<string>`, which was changed when the date-fns support was added.

The minor issue occurs when I try to use the Angular 14's `inject(...)` function call instead of constructor DI-injection, where our previous `@Optional() @Inject(MAT_DATE_LOCALE) dateLocale: string | null` constructor argument cannot be changed to `private readonly dateLocale: string | null = inject(MAT_DATE_LOCALE, {optional: true});` without an additional `as string` cast.

In the pull-request (https://github.com/angular/components/pull/23262), I do see the following two comments mentioning it had been discussed the Monday prior, but I'm curious what has been discussed in that case?

https://github.com/angular/components/pull/23262#pullrequestreview-717428750
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/5364335/0f0569a3-6f31-4d0c-96f7-de641ceff810)

### Reproduction

Step to reproduce:
- Add `private readonly dateLocale: string | null = inject(MAT_DATE_LOCALE, {optional: true});` to any Angular TS file (preferably a DateAdapter, but doesn't matter too much for the reproduction scenario).

### Expected Behavior

`string` should be one of the allowed types of `inject(MAT_DATE_LOCALE)`. Especially since you're using `MAT_DATE_LOCALE_FACTORY()` -> `inject(LOCALE_ID)`, which is of type `InjectionToken<string>`, and [in your own datepicker example page](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/219c6d0874e568fe55f30bb5538cb4f1c724a836/src/components-examples/material/datepicker/index.ts#L113) you're also using a `string` as `useValue`.

### Actual Behavior

I'm getting the `TS2322: Type '{} | null' is not assignable to type 'string | null'.` error, unless I add an `as string` cast.

### Environment

- Angular: 16.0.0
- CDK/Material: 16.0.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(DateAdapter): `MAT_DATE_LOCALE` injection-type doesn't support most commonly used `string`" (#27087)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-checkbox): checkbox is not affected by theme default density
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.2.7

### Description

I am currently migrating from v14 to v15 and i'm now trying to rework my layouts to match the previous v14 look as much as possible.

I have always been using a custom theme and i am importing the component themes on my own (NOT using the `all-component-themes`).

Since everything was a bit smaller in v14 i tried to mimic this by relying on the new density-features. When playing around with v15 and density i have noticed that some components seem to not care about the default density defined in my theme.

A very obvious one is the checkbox which does not care about the default density at all.

There are two checkboxes, a default one and an explicitly denser one. In the theme.scss i have set the default theme density to 0.

A "denser checkbox" is wrapped in a div with css-class "dense", which is used in theme.scss to include the checkbox-density(-3) explicity.

Given i change the theme default density to -3, i expect the default checkbox to shrink to the same size of the explicitly denser checkbox. However the default checkbox stays the same size, ignoring the default density.

A simple form-field/input however proves that the theme is configured properly, since the input will shrink based on the provided theme default density.

### Reproduction

See a minimal reproduction on [stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-autocomplete-density-issue-pzrcpe?file=src/theme.scss)

### Expected Behavior

I expect the checkbox to respect the theme density and shrink accordingly.

### Actual Behavior

The checkbox stays the same size no matter what the theme density is.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.8
- CDK/Material: 15.2.8
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Linux
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-checkbox): checkbox is not affected by theme default density" (#27085)

Issues.Title: matieral tab header: pagination controls flickering
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

15

### Description

At some particular widths, the tab header will jump between two states:

-   display the tab headers with pagination control (ie < on far left and > on far right)
-   display the tab headers without pagination controls

I cannot make a sample code to show this, but it has already appeared on two of my pages. When it happens, the page width is wide enough to show all the tab headers without scrolling. Yet, the <> appears (making the headers to be displayed with less spacing) and then disappears. It is happening at more times per second than my eye can catch. All I can see is a pair of blur images for each tab header, since they are placed at slightly different locations with vs without the <>. On inspection, the class `mat-mdc-tab-header-pagination-controls-enabled` will be applied and removed from the mat-tab-header at top speed. 



### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. 
2.


### Expected Behavior

the tab headers should either be displayed with or without the scrolling  controls < and >

### Actual Behavior

the display is swapping between the two, making the headers unreadable.

### Environment

- Angular: 16.0.1
- CDK/Material: 16.0.1
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "matieral tab header: pagination controls flickering" (#27084)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk/table): Borders in sticky Header
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using sticky headers with `border-collapse: collapse` and borders on the `td` elements (in our case: `border-right`), the border does not remain sticky but scrolls out of the viewport.

![cdktable_sticky_header_border_AdobeExpress](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/14246032/8a29b9af-809f-47f4-a80d-aa45106cf09b)

Repro: https://stackblitz.com/edit/w4lwqg?file=src/app/cdk-table-basic-example.css

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the example https://stackblitz.com/edit/w4lwqg
2. Start scrolling


### Expected Behavior

The dark right border of the table header columns stay where they are

### Actual Behavior

The dark right border of the table header columns leave the viewport

### Environment

- CDK/Material: 16.0.0
